result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drew Casey Lara

defendant.name: Lara, Drew Casey
defendant.address: 762 Georgia Street Apt. B, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Preliminary Hearing - October 24, 2022
Arraignment on November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court addresses victims request to lift the no contact.  State indicates victim now wishes to have the no contact remain in place.  Defense in agreement with no contact remaining in place, has no problem with the GPS request, does request removal of the SCRAM bracelet.  Court not removing SCRAM bracelet today, will let Atty Viel renew his motion at new hearing.  Bond remains in effect as previously set.

8:35 AM  Defendant Drew Casey Lara in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Drew Casey Lara.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness Sturgeon Bay Police Dept Andrew Crabb in court.     Court reviews events in file. Officer Andrew Crabb sworn, testifies.   Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings.  Atty Viel requests arraignment date be set.
Arraignment scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bond Modification Request Affidavit of Indigency
NO Contact Modification Request
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact direct or indirect with H.J.B., her residence or place of employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - High Level.  GPS Monitoring.

State requests the absolute no contact with victim go back into effect, makes statement.  Defense has no objection, makes statement.  Court grants State's request, amends bond to no contact direct or indirect with H.J.B., her residence or place of employment.  All other conditions of bond remain as previously set.

9:01 AM   Defendant Drew Casey Lara in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Drew Casey Lara.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, advises defendant wishes to hire private counsel in this matter, requests adjournment.  State indicates they are ready to proceed today.  Court will give defendant the opportunity to hire private counsel, reschedules prelim. hearing.  Atty Viel not withdrawing from the case yet, will wait to see if defendant has counsel retained or not by 10/24/22.  Court not letting Atty Viel off the case yet, if defendant doesn't have new counsel by 10/24/22, prelim. will proceed as scheduled with Atty Viel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Drew Lara came to Clerk of Courts Office on 8/18/22 and signed bond.

Clerk LS contacted defendant regarding signing amended bond.  Woman that answered the phone questioned whether bond needed to be signed.  Clerk advised that original bond conditions remain in place until amended bond is signed. Once signed, amended bond conditions are then in effect.  Defendant was heard in the background during the call.

No contact direct or indirect with H.J.B., her residence or place of employment EXCEPT - can have text or email contact only.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. GPS Monitoring   Alcohol Monitoring - High Level.  (amended bond does not go into effect until defendant has signed amended bond.  As of 8/05/22 defendant still has not signed amended bond)

11:23 AM  Defendant Drew Casey Lara appeared by phone.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Drew Casey Lara.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, reviews victims request to lift the no contact.  State opposes request, makes statement, asks court to keep the no contact in place.  Atty Viel gives argument on bond modification. Victim makes statement.  Court makes statement, no contact remains in place but will allow text or email contact only.  Court holds victims request in abeyance until after the 9/01/22 preliminary hearing, will then allow victim to renew her request to lift the no contact.
Bail/bond hearing on August 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Bond Modification Request.           Pamela: We need to schedule hearing on this. DTE
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet

10:05 AM  Defendant Drew Casey Lara in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Drew Casey Lara.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Atty Viel to set prelim. with JA Wiegand after court today.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/18/22.
by Ashley Peterson

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - High Level.  GPS Monitoring.   No contact direct or indirect with H.J.B., her residence or place of employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

11:41 AM   Defendant Drew Casey Lara appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Shannon Viel sitting in for todays hearing, indicates defendant may not qualify for SPD representation if he retains employment.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.   Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
